alert.note: Alert for Mason; Muskegon; Oceana; Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 04 at 10:44PM EDT until September 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...High wave action, strong currents, and dangerous swimming conditions expected. Piers may be heavily swamped by waves. * WHERE...Mason, Oceana, Muskegon and Ottawa counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Strong currents can pull swimmers into deeper water and high waves can sweep people off piers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds and waves will increase on Tuesday night and continue into Wednesday. Dangerous swimming conditions are likely on Wednesday. South sides of south piers will be the areas most at risk, including Grand Haven State Park and Pere Marquette Park in Muskegon.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions and do not venture out on piers. Please check with your local authorities on potential beach closures.
